question.body: Which of the following is a possible value of the median number of days that patients were depressed?

response.feedback: Not quite right. It is true that the median is the 53rd observation, but what is the possible value for that observation?
Correct. The median is the 53rd observation, whose value is 170 days.
Incorrect. It seems you are looking at the number of bars and not the number of observations. The median may not be at the center of the distribution.

Incorrect. It seems you are computing the average of 40 and 520, which approximates the middle of the range of the number of depression days, rather than determining the number of days, which divides the group of patients into two equal parts.

part.hint: You are trying to find the possible value of the median. The median is the number of days at which 50% of the patient scores fall above and 50% of the patient scores fall below. Is the number of patients an even or odd number?

Look at the number of patients. If it is even, divide by 2. If the total number of patients is odd, add one to the total number and divide by 2. That gives you the position of the median. What would be a possible value of the number of days for the patient at that position?

Since there are 105 patients, 53 (105/2) is the position of the median. Locate the bar that includes the 53rd observation; the range of possible values of the median would fall between the endpoints of that bar.
